article.headline: Coronavirus tally: Global cases of COVID-19 at 8.19 million, 444,076 deaths and 6 U.S. states see record new cases
article.body: The global case tally for the coronavirus that causes COVID-19 climbed above 8.19 million on Wednesday, according to data aggregated by Johns Hopkins University. The death toll rose to 444,076. More than 3.9 million people have recovered.The U.S. has the highest case toll in the world at 2.14 million and the highest death toll at 116,963, with 6 states reporting their most ever new cases on Tuesday, including Arizona, Florida and Oklahoma. Brazil has 923,189 cases and 45,241 fatalities, the data show, the second-highest death toll in the world. Russia has has 552,549 cases and 7,468 fatalities. India has 354,065 cases and 9,900 deaths. The U.K. has 299,600 cases and 42,054 deaths, the highest death toll in Europe and now third highest in the world. Two early hot spots, Spain has 244,328 cases and 27,136 deaths, while Italy has 237,500 cases and 34,405 deaths. Peru, France, Iran, Germany, Chile, Turkey, Mexico, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, Canada and Bangladesh are next and all ahead of China, where the illness was first reported late last year. China has 84,423 cases and 4,638 deaths. China has shut down parts of Beijing after a fresh cluster of cases.
